articles.title: Jurgen Klopp's "ridiculous" Liverpool claim following Champions League exit to Real Madrid - Mirror Online
articles.description: The Reds crashed out of Europe after they were unable to mount another famous comeback and drew 0-0 at Anfield
articles.content:
Jurgen Klopp has admitted Liverpool's finishing must improve after they were knocked out of the Champions League at the quarter-final stage following a 0-0 draw with Real Madrid on Wednesday.

articles.title: How Mario Draghi Made Italy a Power Player in Europe - The New York Times
articles.description: The new prime minister is leveraging his European relationships and his solid reputation to make Italy a force on the continent in a way it has not been in decades.
articles.content:
The episode has become a clear example of how Mr. Draghi builds relationships with the potential to yield big payoffs not only for himself and Italy, but all of Europe.

articles.title: Ancient tools 'reveal clues about gendered roles in European farming societies' - The Irish News
articles.description: Analysis of 400 stone objects from graves across Europe showed men and women were equal contributors to their community, researchers said.
articles.content:
Ancient tools found in graves across Europe suggest women and men performed specific gender-based tasks in farming societies about 5,000 years ago, according to scientists.

articles.title: Songbirds stay put in winter because gardens are stuffed with food - Telegraph.co.uk
articles.description: Milder climate in UK is also thought to have stopped blackcaps making the long migration to southern Europe
articles.content:
Songbirds are staying all winter because British gardens are stuffed with so much food for them, an Oxford University study has found.
